question_content.barrons:question: Raphael created works that were avidly sought by the most powerful and discriminating secular and ecclesiastical princes of his day. Some favored patrons he readily (i)________; others, like the demanding Isabella dâ€™Este, the overtaxed artist (ii)________ with polite but (iii)________ promises.
question_content.barrons:explanation:
obliged; strung along; idle.

The key phrase is the overtaxed artist. Overtaxed here means stressed or overburdened. What demands stressed the painter Raphael? The demands of the powerful figures who avidly sought to purchase his paintings. How did he deal with these would-be patrons? Some he readily obliged (accommodated); others he strung along (kept waiting in a state of uncertainty) with polite but idle (empty) promises.

Encountered is incorrect. Encountered (met) makes no sense in the context.

Distrusted is incorrect. Distrusted (suspected; doubted) makes no sense in the context.

Told off is incorrect. Told off (rebuked severely) makes no sense in the context: Raphael would have been unlikely to scold a favored patron.

Came across is incorrect. Came across (encountered) makes no sense in the context.

Sincere is incorrect. The phrase polite but ________ has deprecatory overtones. Sincere does not work

in this context.

Pointed is incorrect. Pointed (sharp or piercing; marked) makes no sense in the context.
